title: Simon Cowell cancels 60th birthday celebrations at last minute
text:
It’s his party and he’ll cancel it if he wants to (Picture: Rachel Luna/Getty Images)

Simon Cowell has turned the big 6-0, and we expected a celebration worthy of TV and music royalty.

But the mogul has unexpectedly cancelled his 60th birthday party at the last minute.

Simon was due to mark the milestone birthday with family and celebrity friends, with guests flying in for the intimate dinner at the Chelsea restaurant La Famiglia tonight.

However, on Monday – just two days before the party – Simon and his partner Lauren Silverman, 42, sent out cancellation notices.

Simon and Lauren apologised to their guests (Picture: Jon Kopaloff/FilmMagic)

According to the Mail Online, the cancellation read: ‘I am so sorry but this dinner is cancelled/postponed. Scheduling conflicts unfortunately are prohibiting us from having this dinner at this time.

‘We will keep you posted as to when it will be rescheduled for. Thank you for understanding, Lauren and Simon.’

The original invite jokingly said: ‘Simon is turning 50… + 10! Please join us to celebrate’, under a picture of Cowell as a child.

The dinner at La Famiglia was scheduled for 6.30pm on 30 October.

Simon has launched the X Factor live shows (Picture: Rex/Syco)

A spokesperson for The X Factor star said: ‘The decision was made to postpone the dinner yesterday morning.

‘Simon’s priority is his incredibly busy work schedule over the next month and this, of course, includes the current series of The X Factor as well as other TV and music projects.’

Cowell actually turned 60 0n 7 October and marked the birthday with a small dinner in Los Angeles.

He is expected to rearrange his birthday party for December – because why not stretch out the celebrations for two months?

However, a source told Mail Online: ‘Simon had planned a suitably extravagant event for his 60th and had guests flying in from all over the world to celebrate.

‘Cancelling just days before has really thrown people’s plans up into the air.’

To be fair, looking at the menu of La Famiglia, we’d be pretty sad at missing out, with linguine with lobster, spaghetti vongole, sea bream and T-bone steak on the menu at the fancy Italian restaurant.

Simon – who is dad to five-year-old Eric – kicked off the X Factor: Celebrity live shows last week, so he has plenty on his plate.

The star came under fire from axed contestant Olivia Olson, who was furious at Simon saving Martin Bashir over her, given that Cowell had told her she could win the whole competition.
